iti104:0.3: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
iti104:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti104:2.1: “Mendicants, take a mendicant who is accomplished in ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom. They advise and instruct. They educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire, and can rightly explain the true teaching. Even the sight of those mendicants is very helpful, I say.
iti104:2.6: or go forth after them is very helpful, I say.
iti104:2.8: For one who frequents and associates with such mendicants, their incomplete spectrum of ethics is completed. Their incomplete spectrum of immersion … wisdom … freedom … knowledge and vision of freedom is completed.
iti104:2.9: Such mendicants are called ‘teachers’, ‘leaders of the caravan’, ‘vice-discarder’, ‘dispellers of darkness’, ‘bringers of light’, ‘luminaries’, ‘lamps’, ‘candlebearers’, ‘bringers of radiance’, ‘noble ones’, and ‘seers’.
iti104:2.10: That is what the Buddha said.
iti104:3.3: that is, those who are evolved,
iti104:5.3: directly know the ending of rebirth,
iti104:5.4: they come not back to future lives.”
iti104:6.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
